article.headline: George Mason 95, St. Bonaventure 58
article.story: OLEAN, N.Y. (AP) -- Folarin Campbell had a career-high 19 points to lead George Mason to a 95-58 victory over winless St. Bonaventure Wednesday night. Campbell started a 15-4 run for George Mason (5-3) midway through the second half with two free throws and a 3-pointer. After George Mason started the game on an 8-0 run, the Bonnies cut the deficit to 29-19 in the first half. That was the closest they'd come the rest of the game. It was the largest margin of defeat this season for St. Bonaventure (0-9). Brian Gibbs led the Bonnies with a career-high 19 points. Patrick Lottin added 11. George Mason had seven players score in double digits, with Lamar Butler making four 3-pointers en route to 14 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
